meanings.definition: Fair and impartial in treatment or judgment.
meanings.sent1: The judge made an evenhanded decision in the case.
meanings.sent2: She always tries to be evenhanded when resolving conflicts.
meanings.sent3: The evenhanded referee made sure both teams followed the rules.
meanings.sent4: Her evenhanded approach to leadership earned her respect from everyone.
meanings.sent5: Being evenhanded is crucial for building trust in any relationship.

meanings.definition: Characterized by equal treatment of all sides.
meanings.sent1: An evenhanded approach is essential in negotiations.
meanings.sent2: The manager's evenhanded policies promoted harmony among employees.
meanings.sent3: The evenhanded distribution of snacks at the party surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: His evenhanded attitude towards disagreements helped maintain peace.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's evenhanded grading system was appreciated by all students.
